results.title: Drew Barrymore Is Keeping It Clean
results.abstract: When you’ve acted, directed, written, produced, married, divorced, mothered and sold lipstick, what do you do next in America? Host a talk show, of course.

multimedia.caption: Of her TV demeanor, Ms. Barrymore said, “I gravitate toward a Julia Child or a Lucille Ball rather than trying to do it perfect.”

results.abstract: A 1976 TV movie that imagined years as people is a helpful reminder that a new page on the calendar is an arbitrary creation.

results.abstract: The director makes beautiful bummers in an industry that prefers happy endings. Perhaps that’s why his movies seem like an endangered species.

results.byline: By A.O. Scott and Manohla Dargis
results.abstract: We streamed, we watched, we worried. We also wondered what the catastrophe called 2020 will mean for movies.

multimedia.copyright: Carter Johnston for The New York Times
multimedia.caption: People will want to go back to movie theaters when they can, our critics write, but some of the shifts brought about by the pandemic seem lasting.

results.abstract: For her first lead in a film, the actress wanted a character as challenging as many of those she’s played onstage. She found it in Kornel Mundruczo’s “Pieces of a Woman.”

Fran Lebowitz and Martin Scorsese Seek a Missing New York in ‘Pretend It’s a City’
results.abstract: The Netflix series, featuring Lebowitz and directed by Scorsese, offers acerbic commentary and a sense of yearning for a pre-pandemic metropolis.

multimedia.caption: Martin Scorsese and Fran Lebowitz, as seen in the new Netflix documentary series, “Pretend It’s a City,” are longtime friends. “It’s about being around Fran,” said Scorsese, who directed the series.

results.title: The Force (and a Lenient Disney) Is With ‘Star Wars’ Fan Filmmakers
results.abstract: Whether as tribute or corrective, these movies have proliferated in recent years in part because the studio’s trilogy has inspired strong reactions.

multimedia.caption: Fan filmmakers include Jason Satterlund, with a Stormtrooper in Los Angeles. “We wanted to recreate the love that we had” for the original trilogy, he said.

results.title: Wonder Woman and Her Evolving Look
